EDAspy.optimization.univariate package¶

Submodules¶

EDAspy.optimization.univariate.continuous module¶

class EDAspy.optimization.univariate.continuous.UMDAc(SIZE_GEN, MAX_ITER, DEAD_ITER, ALPHA, vector, aim, cost_function)¶

Bases: object

Univariate marginal Estimation of Distribution algorithm continuous. New individuals are sampled from a vector of univariate normal distributions. It can be used for hyper-parameter optimization or to optimize a function.

…

generation: pandas DataFrame

Last generation of the algorithm.

best_mae_global: float

Best cost found.

best_ind_global: pandas DataFrame

First row of the pandas DataFrame. Can be casted to dictionary.

history: list

List of the costs found during runtime.

SIZE_GEN: int

Parameter set by user. Number of the individuals in each generation.

MAX_ITER: int

Parameter set by user. Maximum number of iterations of the algorithm.

DEAD_ITER: int

Parameter set by user. Number of iterations after which, if no improvement reached, the algorithm finishes.

vector: pandas DataFrame

When initialized, parameters set by the user. When finished, statistics learned by the user.

cost_function:

Set by user. Cost function set to optimize.

check_generation()¶

Check the cost of each individual in the cost function implemented by the user, and updates the generation DataFrame

new_generation()¶

Build a new generation sampled from the vector of probabilities. Updates the generation pandas dataframe

run(output=True)¶

Run method to execute the EDA algorithm

Parameters

output (bool) – True if wanted to print each iteration

Returns

best cost, best individual, history of costs along execution

Return type

float, pandas dataframe, list

truncation()¶

Selection of the best individuals of the actual generation. Updates the generation by selecting the best individuals

update_vector()¶

From the best individuals update the vector of normal distributions in order to the next generation can sample from it. Update the vector of normal distributions.

EDAspy.optimization.univariate.discrete module¶

class EDAspy.optimization.univariate.discrete.UMDAd(MAX_IT, DEAD_ITER, SIZE_GEN, ALPHA, vector, cost_function, aim)¶

Bases: object

Univariate discrete Estimation of Distribution algorithm. New individuals are sampled from a vector of univariate probabilities. It is a binary optimizer, than can be used for example for feature selection.

…

generation: pandas DataFrame

Last generation of the algorithm.

best_MAE_global: float

Best cost found.

best_ind_global: pandas DataFrame

First row of the pandas DataFrame. Can be casted to dictionary.

history: list

List of the costs found during runtime.

SIZE_GEN: int

Parameter set by user. Number of the individuals in each generation.

MAX_IT: int

Parameter set by user. Maximum number of iterations of the algorithm.

DEAD_ITER: int

Parameter set by user. Number of iterations after which, if no improvement reached, the algorithm finishes.

vector: pandas DataFrame

When initialized, parameters set by the user. When finished, statistics learned by the user.

cost_function:

Set by user. Cost function set to optimize.

check_generation()¶

Check the cost of each individual in the cost function implemented by the user

individuals_selection()¶

Selection of the best individuals of the actual generation and updates the generation by selecting the best individuals

new_generation()¶

Build a new generation sampled from the vector of probabilities and updates the generation pandas dataframe

run(output=True)¶

Run method to execute the EDA algorithm

Parameters

output (bool) – True if wanted to print each iteration

Returns

best cost, best individual, history of costs along execution

Return type

float, pandas dataframe, list

update_vector()¶

From the best individuals update the vector of probabilities in order to the next generation can sample from it and update the vector of probabilities
